channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Sterling Secure Proxy
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Sterling Secure Proxy

item.title: CVE-2021-29722|2024-09-16T16:32:56.811Z -- ibm -- sterling%20secure%20proxy
item.description: IBM Sterling Secure Proxy 6.0.1, 6.0.2, 2.4.3.2, and 3.4.3.2 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 201095.

item.title: CVE-2021-29728|2024-09-16T16:53:36.442Z -- ibm -- sterling%20secure%20proxy
item.description: IBM Sterling Secure Proxy 6.0.1, 6.0.2, 2.4.3.2, and 3.4.3.2 contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key, which it uses for its own inbound authentication, outbound communication to external components, or encryption of internal data. IBM X-Force ID: 201160.

item.title: CVE-2020-4462|2024-09-16T16:53:09.458Z -- ibm -- sterling%20secure%20proxy
item.description: IBM Sterling External Authentication Server 6.0.1, 6.0.0, 2.4.3.2, and 2.4.2 and IBM Sterling Secure Proxy 6.0.1, 6.0.0, 3.4.3, and 3.4.2 are vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 181482.
